names.pinyin: huang jing dang shen sheng ya tang
names.english: polygonatum and codonopsis raise the blood pressure decoction
names.commonEnglish: Polygonatum and Codonopsis Raise the Blood Pressure Decoction

actions: Raises Spleen Yang and stops diarrhea.
Invigorates the Blood and promotes the movement of Qi.
Tonifies Spleen Qi, nurtures Stomach Yin, tonifies the Kidneys and strengthens Jing.
With Dang Shen and Fu Ling, for Spleen and Stomach Qi Deficiency.
Tonifies the Middle Jiao, augments Qi, tonifies the Lungs, nourishes the Blood and promotes the generation of Body Fluids.
With Fu Ling, for Spleen and Stomach Deficiency with fatigue, a sensation of fullness in the abdomen, dizziness, lethargy, shortness of breath, anorexia and loose stools or diarrhea.
Dries Dampness, transforms Phlegm and harmonizes the Stomach.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness and strengthens the Spleen.
With Zhi Ban Xia, treats Phlegm, thin mucus and turbid Dampness.
Transforms turbid Dampness, harmonizes the Middle Jiao, awakens the Spleen, promotes the movement of Qi and promotes Blood flow.

Reduces and guides out Food Stagnation, transforms accumulations, transforms Blood Stasis, invigorates Blood circulation and treats hypertension, elevated serum cholesterol, and coronary artery disease.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, clears Heat and cools the Blood.
Calms the Liver, anchors Liver Yang and reduces Blood pressure and serum cholesterol.

syndromes: Qi Deficiency with Blood Stasis and Phlegm Turbidity

symptoms: Blood pressure that is sometimes low and sometimes high
manifestations.tongue: Dark with possible static spots or macules
